data.title: Connect With Us
data.meta_description: If you have questions about navigating the application process at NC State, our dedicated team can help.
data.text:
We’re Here to Help

Need some support as you navigate the admissions process at NC State? Our dedicated team is ready to guide you from your first step to your final decision.

Hours of Availability

Monday through Friday from 8 a.m. until 5 p.m. ET, except university holidays.

Email

Contact undergrad-admissions@ncsu.edu for general admissions questions, or if you’d like to update an existing application, add new information, report a class change or request a major change.

Contact campusvisits@ncsu.edu for questions about campus visits or virtual information sessions.

Phone

919.515.2434

If you’d like to talk about deadlines, check on your transcript or speak with a member of our admissions staff about a specific question, we recommend reaching our office by phone for the quickest response.

Where To Find Us

Admissions staff are available at our on-campus locations to meet with prospective students and families during regular business hours. Walk-ins are welcome, no appointment necessary.

Joyner Visitor Center

Prospective students and families may visit the Joyner Visitor Center to meet with a member of our admissions staff. Free visitor parking is available in front of the building.

1210 Varsity Drive

NC State University – Main Campus

Campus Visits Office

Admissions staff are available at Talley Student Union to meet with prospective students and families. Visitors can check in for the in-person information session in this office.

Talley Student Union – Room 2121 (main floor)

Campus Visits Parking Address

Coliseum Parking Deck

Pay Lot (enter lower level from Cates Avenue)

201 Jensen Drive

Raleigh, NC 27607

Visitor Resources

Mailing Admissions Materials

Applicants mailing their transcripts or other admissions materials to our office will find our mailing information below. You also have the option to submit your transcript electronically.

Admission materials should not be mailed to our Campus Visits office in Talley Student Union. All mailed materials must be specifically addressed to “Office of Undergraduate Admissions.”

Use the Postal Information address if your material is sent through the United States Postal Service (USPS). Use the Courier Address if your material is sent through UPS, FedEx, DHL or other shipping carriers.

Engage With Us

It’s our goal to assist you in the most effective way possible, and we try to respond to all admissions queries within one business day.

There are other opportunities to connect with us, too — whether you’re looking for an introduction to NC State, one-on-one support, timely updates or anything else.

Attend a Virtual Information Session

Want to learn more about our university and the admissions process? Hear from an admissions officer during a 30-minute live presentation that includes a Q&A. Your Zoom meeting link will be provided once you register.

Find Us on Social Media

Follow our social media channels to stay up to date on admissions information and get a glimpse into life at NC State.
